channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Inflation rate at 2.4% in September, topping expectations; jobless claims highest since August 2023
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to show a 0.1% increase in September and a 2.3% gain from a year ago, according to Dow Jones consensus estimates.

item.title: Airbus monthly deliveries fall, piling pressure on annual target as production woes persist
item.description: "Reaching year end delivery guidance will be challenging, but not impossible," analysts at Deutsche Bank said.

item.title: Left and right prey on weak French government as it prepares 'austerity' budget
item.description: France's new and already beleaguered government is to present its 2025 budget Thursday amid an ongoing fiscal crisis for the euro zone's second-largest economy.

item.title: Ripple launches crypto storage services for banks in bid to diversify
item.description: Ripple said it is launching a slew of features aimed at helping banks and fintechs store digital tokens — as part of a broader push into crypto custody.

item.title: Tributes pour in for Ratan Tata from industry titans and politicians
item.description: Tata is credited with taking his business house global via several high-profile acquisitions including that of Jaguar-Land Rover in 2008.

item.title: Delta sales guidance disappoints, CEO says it expects lower demand around the election
item.description: Delta Air Lines expects to grow earnings in the fourth quarter, thanks to resilient travel demand and strong bookings for year-end holidays.

item.title: 7-Eleven's parent company cuts full-year earnings forecast, presses ahead with restructuring
item.description: The news comes as the Japanese retail group resists a takeover attempt by Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard.

item.title: He flies business and first class multiple times a year — all on credit card points
item.description: Flying business and first class may seem out of reach for most travelers, but a right mix of credit cards can speed up the journey to those coveted cabins.

item.title: Fed officials were divided on whether to cut rates by half a point in September, minutes show
item.description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday releases minutes from its Sept. 17-18 policy meeting.

item.title: Luxury hotel is looking for ‘CEO’ to take $15,000 trip around the world: How to apply
item.description: Ramada by Wyndham is looking to hire a 'chief eats officer' to show off its many locations on social media.

item.title: Warren Buffett's S&P 500 bet paid off. Experts weigh in on whether it's still a winning strategy
item.description: Investing in an S&P 500 index fund can let you take a set-it-and-forget-it approach. But some experts say you could be missing an opportunity to diversify.

item.title: Former Pfizer CEO, finance chief step back from Starboard's activist campaign
item.description: The about face comes as the board grapples with the activist's efforts, and just days before Starboard's Jeff Smith was slated to meet with the CEO, sources said.

item.title: Nvidia shares are up 25% in the last month, rallying near a record ahead of tech earnings
item.description: Nvidia shares have surged 25% over the last month, with analysts maintaining a bullish outlook as earnings season approaches.

item.title: China's Golden Week holiday signals persistent consumer caution
item.description: China's Golden Week holiday affirmed a trend in more cautious spending, while consumers put greater emphasis on experiences.

item.title: OpenAI says bad actors are using its platform to disrupt elections, but with little 'viral engagement'
item.description: OpenAI said in a report that it continues to see threat actors attempt to use its products, like ChatGPT, to influence election outcomes.

item.title: Hurricane Milton makes landfall in Florida as Category 3 storm
item.description: The NHC said the storm had sustained winds of up to 120 mph as it warned of a life-threatening storm surge, extreme winds and flash flooding.

item.title: ‘She doesn't stop talking’: How extroverts unknowingly irritate fellow travelers
item.description: Hours of chatting. Jam-packed vacation days. The same activities that extroverts thrive on can overwhelm their introverted travel companions.

item.title: Baidu's robotaxi unit is exploring expansion into global markets in the 'near future'
item.description: Chinese tech company Baidu's robotaxi unit Apollo Go is in talks to expand overseas in the near future, according to a source familiar with the situation.

item.title: DOJ indicates it’s considering Google breakup following monopoly ruling
item.description: The Department of Justice late Tuesday indicated that it was considering a possible breakup of Google as an antitrust remedy.

item.title: As interest rates fall, it's a 'fantastic time' to revisit bonds, advisor says — here's why
item.description: As the Federal Reserve cuts interest rates, investors should revisit their bond portfolio, experts say. Here's which bonds could see a boost.

item.title: China's property stimulus raises optimism — but more steps are needed for a sectoral turnaround
item.description: Home sales during the Golden Week holiday — which is traditionally a peak period for big-ticket spendings — have been on a multi-year decline since 2021.

item.title: HSBC exec says there's a lot of AI 'success theater' happening in finance
item.description: Some financial services firms are making bold statements about AI but not seeing tangible results, according to HSBC's head of generative AI.

item.title: Mining giant Rio Tinto to acquire Arcadium Lithium in $6.7 billion deal
item.description: The world's second-largest miner Rio Tinto said Wednesday it will acquire U.S. lithium producer Arcadium for $6.7 billion.

item.title: Swedish battery maker Northvolt says head of Europe’s first homegrown gigafactory to step down
item.description: It comes shortly after the cash-strapped company announced plans to reduce its workforce by about 25% in Sweden as part of a major cost-cutting drive.

item.title: Bayer shares drop 7% after U.S. court says it will review Monsanto case
item.description: The company said in a statement Wednesday that there was "no basis for a different outcome on appeal."

item.title: CVS, UnitedHealth, Cigna say FTC should take Lina Khan and two commissioners off drug middlemen case
item.description: The companies argue the commissioners have "a lengthy track record of making public statements that indicate serious bias" against pharmacy benefit managers.

item.title: Ozempic underworld: Inside the black market of obesity drugs
item.description: A CNBC investigation into illegal weight loss drugs reveals a marketplace where criminals brazenly counterfeit the drugs or ship the real product from overseas.

item.title: Sweden's Volvo says deputy CEO to step down in management reshuffle as EV demand slows
item.description: It comes shortly after Volvo Cars abandoned its near-term goal of selling only electric vehicles, citing a need to be "pragmatic and flexible."

item.title: Weekly mortgage demand drops as interest rates hit the highest level since August
item.description: Applications to refinance a home loan fell last week.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Opportunity in October’s choppiness for stocks
item.description: The see-saw motion of stocks in October isn’t all that bad if investors can seize the right time to enter the market or solidify their positions further.
